Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off then move forward towards the tall building then turn left and move forward. move forward until it get closer to the building then turn left and look up then fly higher and forward then turn left. move forward and fly lower between the buildings then move forward until it get closer to the building fly lower then turn left. turn right and move forward towards the building until it get closer to the advertisement board then turn left. turn right and move forward to get closer to the building then turn right and fly higher and move forward towards the corner building along the road then turn right. move forward until it get closer to the building then turn left and fly lower towards the ground then turn left and move forward towards the tree then fly lower to the ground then turn right. turn right and turn left then look around the place then look up to focus the car advertisement board in the building.]. At the initial position, you are asked to move according to a series of movement instructions. In terms of next steps, what is your best next step?  
choose:  
A. I turn left and go up.  
B. I descend and then fly forward.  
C. I fly forward while rotating the camera upward.  
D. I fly forward and turn right.  
E. I rotate the camera down and then to the right.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: C; Reason: The initial instruction is to "take off then move forward towards the tall building then turn left and move forward." Given the starting position on a rooftop with a clear view of the cityscape, the best next step is to fly forward while rotating the camera upward to align with the direction towards the tall building as instructed. This matches option C.

As the agent takes off and moves forward, the tall building, which is initially seen somewhat above the current eye level (especially considering the rooftop in the foreground), would require the camera to rotate upward to keep it in view and align with the direction of movement. Therefore, "fly forward while rotating the camera upward" (Option C) is the most appropriate next step, combining the ascent (implied by "take off" and upward camera rotation to clear the immediate foreground) and the forward movement towards the target. The video from 0:05 to 0:15 visually confirms this initial upward and forward movement with the camera adjusting its pitch. The provided answer is correct.
